==Useful Info==
'''Sleepcaps''' are early [[Dungeon]] monsters, appearing on D:4-8. Their melee attacks have a 50% chance to put the opponent to [[sleep]] if any damage is dealt. [[Unbreathing]] creatures are immune to sleep-inducing spores.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Sleep is threatening to any character vulnerable to it. Being put to sleep gives monsters a free turn to hit you, during which your [[EV]] is reduced to 0, and you take 2.5x melee damage. When it gets the sleep effect, the sleepcap alone can deal up to 32 damage per round.
**If you are immune to sleep ([[Undead]], [[Gargoyle]], [[Djinni]], have [[clarity]], or during [[berserk]]) or are unbreathing ([[Ice Form]]), then you have much less to fear.

==History==
*Sleepcaps were added in [[0.30]].
